sec.div: Quantum Yields for One-Electron Reduction of Photosensitizers
sec.p: A 4-mL DMA–TEOA (5:1 v/v) solution of the photosesnsitizer (0.1 mM) and BIH (0.2 M) in a quartz cubic cell (light pass length: 1 cm) was purged with Ar for 20 min, and then irradiated with the 500-W Xe lamp combined with a 480-nm (FWHM = 10 nm) bandpass filter (Asahi Spectra Co.), ND filter, and a 5-cm-long H 2O solution filter. UV–vis absorption spectral changes during irradiation were measured using a Photal MCPD-9800 spectrometer (Otsuka Electronics). The light intensity was determined as 5.0 × 10 −9 einstein·s −1 using a K 3Fe(C 2O 4) 3 actinometer.(Hatchard and Parker, 1956) The amount of OERS of Ru(pic) was calculated using the molar absorption coefficient of OERS (500–700 nm) obtained by electrochemical spectroscopy.
